title: Liam Payne blasts rude New Yorkers: "I'd like to be able to see New York without being followed"
text:
Celeb Travel 
One Direction star Liam Payne has taken aim at rude fans in New York after he was verbally attacked for turning down requests for photos during a night out. 
The 'Drag Me Down' hitmaker reveals he and a group of friends were simply trying to get back to their hotel safely on Monday, when he was accosted by members of the public. 
Taking to Twitter.com to rant about the encounter, he wrote, "Why is it that in New York people think it's ok to swear and shout horrible things at you in the street Just because u don't feel like taking a picture because there's paparazzi chasing you and you want to get your family and friends home safe... 
"One time id (sic) like to be able to see New York without being followed chased and cornered like an animal until other people get what they want". One time id like to be able to see New York without being followed chased and cornered like an animal until other people get what they want — Liam (@Real_Liam_Payne) August 4, 2015 
Bandmate Niall Horan echoed the statements on his Twitter.com account, saying, "Cmon guys , just lay off on the chases today please , been a long day so far, just wana (sic) relax and enjoy the city with my friends , thank you." Cmon guys , just lay off on the chases today please , been a long day so far, just wana relax and enjoy the city with my friends , thank you — Niall Horan (@NiallOfficial) August 4, 2015 
One Direction was in the Big Apple ahead of a performance in Central Park on Tuesday morning for U.S. breakfast show Good Morning America, where member Louis Tomlinson finally spoke out about his impending fatherhood, admitting: "It's an exciting time." 
U.S. TV host Michael Strahan congratulated Tomlinson on the pregnancy during the live broadcast and the singer appeared uncomfortable when the subject was brought up. 
Strahan asked, "How are you feeling?" and Tomlinson replied, "Thank you... Obviously it's a very exciting time. I'm buzzing. So thank you." 
One Direction are next due to take their tour to New Jersey on Wednesday. Reader's comments »
